hint.text: Use the formula for an isothermal reversible change and note that \(q=-w\). Find the value of q.

solution.text:
For an isothermal reversible change. \(q =\;- w = 2.303 \times n \times R \times T \times log \frac{V_f}{V_i}\)
Note that \(nRT = P_1 \times V_1 = _{j}_\)
\(\implies q =\;- w = 2.303 \times _{j}_ \times log \frac{_{{10*k}}_ }{_{k}_}\)
\(\implies q =\;- w = 2.303 \times _{j}_ \times 1\)
\(\implies q =\;- w = _{{j*2.303}}_\) litre-atm

content.text: _{k}_ litres of an ideal gas at a pressure of _{j}_ atm expands reversibly and isothermally against a external pressure of 1 atm until its total volume is _{{10*k}}_ litres. How much heat is absorbed and during the expansion? (Write the answer accurate to three decimal places)
